  • Constructor Details

    • DragAndDrop

      public DragAndDrop()

  • Method Details

    • onTrackList

      public void onTrackList(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Handles double-click events on the playlist ListView. This method checks if a media file is double-clicked in the playlist, and if so, it stops any currently playing media, and plays the selected file.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - the mouse event that triggered this method, including details like click count and selected item.

    • onPreviousTrack

      public void onPreviousTrack(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the action of moving to the previous track in the playlist. This method decrements the current index, stops any currently playing media, and plays the previous track if available.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event triggered by clicking the previous button.

    • onNextTrack

      public void onNextTrack(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the action of moving to the next track in the playlist. This method increments the current index, stops any currently playing media, and plays the next track if available.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event triggered by clicking the next button.

    • onPlayPause

      public void onPlayPause(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Toggles the play and pause state of the currently loaded media in the media player. This method pauses the media if it is currently playing, or plays the media if it is paused.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event triggered by clicking the play/pause button.

    • onStop

      public void onStop(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Stops the playback of the currently loaded media in the media player. This method also resets the progress bar to zero and optionally reloads the currently selected media file for future playback.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event triggered by clicking the stop button.

    • updateUserInfo

      public void updateUserInfo(String userName)
      Updates the user information display in the UI. This method sets the user's name label and updates the user's image based on a generated URL that likely links to an avatar service.
      Parameters:
      userName - the user's name to display.
